meanings.definition: The process of making vectors or functions orthogonal to each other.
meanings.sent1: During the orthogonalization process, the vectors are adjusted to be perpendicular to each other.
meanings.sent2: In math class, we learned about orthogonalization and how it helps simplify calculations.
meanings.sent3: The vectors decided to go through orthogonalization training to avoid bumping into each other.
meanings.sent4: Her mind went through an orthogonalization process, clearing out any conflicting thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The orthogonalization of the functions made it easier to analyze their relationship.

meanings.definition: The act of transforming a set of vectors into an orthogonal set.
meanings.sent1: After the orthogonalization, the vectors were no longer overlapping.
meanings.sent2: The orthogonalization of the vectors improved the accuracy of the calculations.
meanings.sent3: The vectors threw a party to celebrate their successful orthogonalization.
meanings.sent4: His ideas went through an orthogonalization process, aligning perfectly with each other.
meanings.sent5: The orthogonalization of the set made it easier to work with in the analysis.
